risk_description: Mobile offline data synchronization logic using local databases (SQLite/WatermelonDB) may encounter severe data consistency conflicts and race conditions upon network restoration, jeopardizing the integrity of service requests.
root_cause: Complexity of bi-directional sync, conflict resolution strategies in distributed systems, and handling partial uploads during intermittent connectivity.
mitigation_strategy: Implement 'Last-Write-Wins' strategy for simple fields and operational transformation or differential syncing for complex objects. Utilize WatermelonDB's built-in sync adapter. Design idempotent backend APIs to handle duplicate replay requests safely.
contingency_plan: Implement a 'Force Fetch' fallback that prompts users to resolve conflicts manually via UI if automated resolution fails.
monitoring_trigger: Sync error rate exceeding 1% in mobile app telemetry logs; detection of duplicate transaction IDs in backend.

risk_description: Apple App Store and Google Play Store may reject the technician application due to stringent background location permission requirements if battery optimization and usage transparency are not proven adequate.
root_cause: Platform providers (Apple/Google) aggressively restrict 'Always On' background location access to preserve battery life and user privacy.
mitigation_strategy: Implement 'While Using' permission logic where possible; utilize 'foreground service' notifications on Android. Create detailed usage description strings in Info.plist. Implement logic to stop tracking immediately upon job completion.
contingency_plan: Fallback to 'pings' at specific intervals (e.g., every 5 mins) rather than real-time streaming if stores reject continuous background tracking.
monitoring_trigger: App Store rejection notification or Beta tester reports of excessive battery drain (>15% per hour).

risk_description: Real-time technician location tracking via WebSockets may fail to meet the <2s latency requirement under high load due to bottlenecks in the Redis Pub/Sub adapter or NestJS Gateway scaling limits.
root_cause: High volume of location emission events (e.g., 1 per second per technician) overwhelming the message broker or event loop.
mitigation_strategy: Implement throttling at the mobile client level (e.g., only send update if moved > 20 meters). Use distinct Redis instances for Pub/Sub vs. Caching. Configure horizontal autoscaling (HPA) for WebSocket gateway pods.
contingency_plan: Degrade service level to polling mechanism (pull based) at 10-second intervals for location updates if WebSocket infrastructure buckles.
monitoring_trigger: WebSocket message latency > 1.5s; CPU throttling on Gateway pods.

risk_description: Configuration of Azure AD B2C custom policies for complex multi-persona (Consumer, Tech, Admin) authentication flows may exceed team capability, causing delays in securing API endpoints.
root_cause: Azure AD B2C custom policies utilize XML-based configuration (Identity Experience Framework) which has a steep learning curve and limited debugging tools.
mitigation_strategy: Engage an Azure Identity consultant for initial setup review. Utilize standard User Flows where possible before dropping down to Custom Policies. Implement strict integration tests early.
contingency_plan: Simplify auth requirements for MVP (e.g., remove complex custom claims mapping) or switch to a managed auth provider wrapper like Auth0 if B2C proves unmanageable.
monitoring_trigger: Authentication integration tasks slipping schedule by > 3 days.

risk_description: GDPR 'Right to be Forgotten' compliance is jeopardized by immutable audit logs and distributed data storage (Backups, Event Bus, Redis), leading to potential regulatory fines.
root_cause: Conflict between the requirement for 'Immutable Audit Logs' and the legal requirement to delete PII upon request.
mitigation_strategy: Design audit logs to store PII references (User IDs) rather than raw PII. When a user requests deletion, scrub the User table, effectively anonymizing the immutable logs. Implement crypto-shredding for backup archives.
contingency_plan: Manual intervention process for Data Subject Access Requests (DSAR) if automated anonymization fails.
monitoring_trigger: Security audit identifying raw PII in log streams (Application Insights).

risk_description: PostGIS spatial queries for technician routing may cause database CPU spikes, violating the P95 < 250ms latency requirement as the dataset of service requests and service areas grows.
root_cause: Complex spatial joins (ST_Contains, ST_DWithin) are computationally expensive without proper spatial indexing and tuning.
mitigation_strategy: Ensure GiST indexes are applied to all geometry columns. Offload read-heavy spatial analytics to read replicas. Pre-calculate service area assignments asynchronously where possible.
contingency_plan: Scale up Azure PostgreSQL SKU (vCore count) temporarily while optimizing query plans.
monitoring_trigger: Database CPU utilization > 70% or Slow Query Logs showing spatial queries > 100ms.
